#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Chapter XXII
#Text=The inhabitants of the HUT received me with a mixture of joy and surprize .
#Text=Their homely welcome , and their artless sympathy , were grateful to my feelings .
#Text=In the midst of their inquiries , as to my health , they avoided all allusions to the source of my malady .
#Text=They were honest creatures , and I loved them well .
#Text=I participated in the tears which they shed when I mentioned to them my speedy departure for Europe , and promised to acquaint them with my welfare during my long absence .
#Text=They expressed great surprize when I informed them of my intention to visit my cottage .
#Text=Alarm and foreboding overspread their features , and they attempted to dissuade me from visiting an house which they firmly believed to be haunted by a thousand ghastly apparitions .
#Text=These apprehensions , however , had no power over my conduct .
#Text=I took an irregular path which led me to my own house .
#Text=All was vacant and forlorn .
#Text=A small enclosure , near which the path led , was the burying-ground belonging to the family .
#Text=This I was obliged to pass .

#Text=Once I had intended to enter it , and ponder on the emblems and inscriptions which my uncle had caused to be made on the tombs of Catharine and her children ; but now my heart faltered as I approached , and I hastened forward , that distance might conceal it from my view .
#Text=When I approached the recess , my heart again sunk .
#Text=I averted my eyes , and left it behind me as quickly as possible .
#Text=Silence reigned through my habitation , and a darkness which closed doors and shutters produced .
#Text=Every object was connected with mine or my brother 's history .
#Text=I passed the entry , mounted the stair , and unlocked the door of my chamber .
#Text=It was with difficulty that I curbed my fancy and smothered my fears .
#Text=Slight movements and casual sounds were transformed into beckoning shadows and calling shapes .
#Text=I proceeded to the closet .
#Text=I opened and looked round it with fearfulness .
#Text=All things were in their accustomed order .
#Text=I sought and found the manuscript where I was used to deposit it .
#Text=This being secured , there was nothing to detain me ; yet I stood and contemplated awhile the furniture and walls of my chamber .
#Text=I remembered how long this apartment had been a sweet and tranquil asylum ; I compared its former state with its present dreariness , and reflected that I now beheld it for the last time .
#Text=Here it was that the incomprehensible behaviour of Carwin was witnessed : this the stage on which that enemy of man shewed himself for a moment unmasked .
#Text=Here the menaces of murder were wafted to my ear ; and here these menaces were executed .
#Text=These thoughts had a tendency to take from me my self-command .
#Text=My feeble limbs refused to support me , and I sunk upon a chair .
#Text=Incoherent and half-articulate exclamations escaped my lips .
#Text=The name of Carwin was uttered , and eternal woes , woes like that which his malice had entailed upon us , were heaped upon him .
#Text=I invoked all-seeing heaven to drag to light and to punish this betrayer , and accused its providence for having thus long delayed the retribution that was due to so enormous a guilt .
#Text=I have said that the window shutters were closed .
#Text=A feeble light , however , found entrance through the crevices .
#Text=A small window illuminated the closet , and the door being closed , a dim ray streamed through the key-hole .
#Text=A kind of twilight was thus created , sufficient for the purposes of vision ; but , at the same time , involving all minuter objects in obscurity .
#Text=This darkness suited the colour of my thoughts .
#Text=I sickened at the remembrance of the past .
#Text=The prospect of the future excited my loathing .
#Text=I muttered in a low voice , Why should I live longer ?
#Text=Why should I drag a miserable being ?
#Text=All , for whom I ought to live , have perished .
#Text=Am I not myself hunted to death ?
#Text=At that moment , my despair suddenly became vigorous .
#Text=My nerves were no longer unstrung .
#Text=My powers , that had long been deadened , were revived .
#Text=My bosom swelled with a sudden energy , and the conviction darted through my mind , that to end my torments was , at once , practicable and wise .
#Text=I knew how to find way to the recesses of life .
#Text=I could use a lancet with some skill , and could distinguish between vein and artery .
#Text=By piercing deep into the latter , I should shun the evils which the future had in store for me , and take refuge from my woes in quiet death .
#Text=I started on my feet , for my feebleness was gone , and hasted to the closet .
#Text=A lancet and other small instruments were preserved in a case which I had deposited here .
#Text=Inattentive as I was to foreign considerations , my ears were still open to any sound of mysterious import that should occur .
#Text=I thought I heard a step in the entry .
#Text=My purpose was suspended , and I cast an eager glance at my chamber door , which was open .
#Text=No one appeared , unless the shadow which I discerned upon the floor , was the outline of a man .
#Text=If it were , I was authorized to suspect that some one was posted close to the entrance , who possibly had overheard my exclamations .
#Text=My teeth chattered , and a wild confusion took place of my momentary calm .
#Text=Thus it was when a terrific visage had disclosed itself on a former night .
#Text=Thus it was when the evil destiny of Wieland assumed the lineaments of something human .
#Text=What horrid apparition was preparing to blast my sight ?
